headline.main: Samsung 3Q Operating Profit Surges, Shares Jump 9 Percent
headline.print_headline: Samsung 3Q Operating Profit Surges, Shares Jump 9 Percent

docs.snippet: Samsung Electronics announced a forecast-beating profit for the third quarter Wednesday, sending its share price up nearly 9 percent, but analysts said strong component sales and favorable currency exchange rates masked persistent weakness in its ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Samsung Electronics announced a forecast-beating profit for the third quarter Wednesday, sending its share price up nearly 9 percent, but analysts said strong component sales and favorable currency exchange rates masked persistent weakness in its smartphone business.

docs.snippet: KROHN--Barbara Ehrenwald of New York City, October 5, of ALS. Beloved wife, mother, grandmother, artist, iconoclast and friend. Born in Bratislava, Czechoslovakia in 1935, she spent 7 years in England with mother Anny and father, author/psychiatri...
docs.lead_paragraph: KROHN--Barbara Ehrenwald of New York City, October 5, of ALS. Beloved wife, mother, grandmother, artist, iconoclast and friend. Born in Bratislava, Czechoslovakia in 1935, she spent 7 years in England with mother Anny and father, author/psychiatrist, Jan Ehrenwald, before coming to the USA in 1946. She graduated from Smith College in 1956 and was married to ophthalmologist/professor David Krohn from 1957 until his 2002 death. Her career as an editor/literary agent started at Houghton Mifflin, then she became Publisher and Editor-in-Chief of Balsam Press. Her ceramic sculptures have appeared in many shows, most recently at Teatown Lake Reservation and the National Arts Club. She is survived by daughters, Deborah and Lisa, son-in-law Adam Wolfe, and grandchildren Livia, Martine, Sammy, Olive and Eero. Graveside service 1:00 pm Friday, October 9th at Sharon Gardens, Valhalla, NY.

docs.lead_paragraph:
STEINHAUSER--Shirley,

on October 2, 2015. Her close friendships were central in her life, with love from her many friends.

docs.snippet: BENARDO--Helene, devoted and determined mother of Sanford (Kathy) and Leonard (Jennifer), and loving wife for fifty-four years of Leo, passed away on October 5 after a short bout with cancer. She was 80. Helene leaves behind a legacy rich with wri...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BENARDO--Helene,

devoted and determined mother of Sanford (Kathy) and Leonard (Jennifer), and loving wife for fifty-four years of Leo, passed away on October 5 after a short bout with cancer. She was 80. Helene leaves behind a legacy rich with writing, teaching and unconditional love for her family. For many years a literature teacher at the Bronx High School of Science, Helene edited the school's feminist magazine and taught a beloved course on women in literature. Her dear friends, Stella Economou and Marilyn Reinhardt, provided her comradeship for decades.

docs.snippet: WALLAU--Alex Lee II, died on his 98th birthday, October 2, 2015, at home in Palm Beach, FL. Born in Great Barrington, MA in 1917 to Grace and Alex Lee Wallau. Graduated from High School in Harrison, NY. Served in the US Army 1940-46. Paratrooper i...
docs.lead_paragraph:
WALLAU--Alex Lee II,

died on his 98th birthday, October 2, 2015, at home in Palm Beach, FL. Born in Great Barrington, MA in 1917 to Grace and Alex Lee Wallau. Graduated from High School in Harrison, NY. Served in the US Army 1940-46. Paratrooper in the 82nd Airborne. Rose to rank of Major. Formerly of The Bronx and Riverside, CT, Mr. Wallau was the President of The Bonnie Doon Company, a manufacturer of high fashion women's hosiery. Predeceased by his beloved wife, Susan Huguley Wallau and daughters, Anne Ward Wallau and Susan Wallau de Rohm and son-in-law, Jose "Puchy" Rohm, he is survived by his brother Charles L. "Bill" Wallau and by his children Alex Wallau III (Martha), Elizabeth Wallau Howard (Edgar), Ward Wallau (Liz), Sheldon Wallau, Claire Wallau Musso (Carlos) and his grandchildren: Ali Rohm Young (Marcelo), Jose "JJ" (Lucilla) and Maximiliano Rohm, Grace and Keating Wallau, Ruby and Charles Wallau, Graham Faught, Christopher and Charles Howard and three great- grandchildren: Alexia and Martina Young and Alex Rohm. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated on Saturday, October 10th at St. Catherine's Church in Riverside, CT at 11am. Condolences may be offered at www.leopgallaghergreen wich.com.

docs.snippet: CONSTABLE--Elise Jewett, of New York City passed away peacefully on Wednesday, September 9th, 2015. Elise was born on February, 17th, 1930, in Baltimore, MD. Her parents were Henry L. Constable, ESQ., and Gertrude J. Constable of Elkton, MD. After...
docs.lead_paragraph:
CONSTABLE--Elise Jewett,

of New York City passed away peacefully on Wednesday, September 9th, 2015. Elise was born on February, 17th, 1930, in Baltimore, MD. Her parents were Henry L. Constable, ESQ., and Gertrude J. Constable of Elkton, MD. After graduation from the Tatnall School in Wilmington, DE, where she was class valedictorian, she was presented at the Baltimore Cotillion in Maryland. She was employed by the DuPont Company in both Wilmington and NYC. In 1972, she joined Fiduciary Trust International where she was the Assistant to the Chairman of the Board. She retired as an Officer of the bank in 1997. Elise was a member of the Colony Club, the Junior League, the Holland Dames, and the Garden Club, all in NYC. Upon her retirement, Elise enjoyed traveling and spending time with her nieces and nephews. She is survived by her brother Richard Constable, her sister-in-law, Anne Constable, both of Madison, CT and six nieces and nephews - Ashley Constable Neary of NYC, Cody Constable of NYC, Diana du Pont of Ft. Wayne, IN, and Melinda Beard, Anthony du Pont, and Edmond du Pont, all of California. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to Memorial Sloan Kettering. Her memorial service is to be held on October 15th at St. James Church in NYC at 2:00pm.

docs.snippet: LORILLARD--Alice W., of Far Hills, N.J., died peacefully at home, September 29th. She was the daughter of the late Richard and Gertrude Sheldon Whitney She is survived by her children, Lisa Halsted and her husband, Scott of Mill Valley, CA and Pet...
docs.lead_paragraph: LORILLARD--Alice W., of Far Hills, N.J., died peacefully at home, September 29th. She was the daughter of the late Richard and Gertrude Sheldon Whitney She is survived by her children, Lisa Halsted and her husband, Scott of Mill Valley, CA and Peter Lorillard and his wife, Vicki of Bedminster and six grandchildren. A memorial mass will be held on Thursday, October 29th, 11:00 at St. Elizabeth's Church, Peapack, NJ. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be sent to Essex Foxhounds, P.O. Box 295, Gladstone, NJ 07934.

docs.snippet: FRACKMAN--Robert, age 89, passed away peacefully on October 5 from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. He is survived by his wife of 23 years, Risa; son, David; daughter-in-law, Kirsten Cole; and grandsons, Max and Zeke. He was a graduate of Riverside ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
FRACKMAN--Robert,

age 89, passed away peacefully on October 5 from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. He is survived by his wife of 23 years, Risa; son, David; daughter-in-law, Kirsten Cole; and grandsons, Max and Zeke. He was a graduate of Riverside Military Academy, attended Syracuse University, and served in the US Air Corps. He was an energetic and successful entrepreneur, having distinguished himself as the owner of the Incentive Corporation of America and Treetops Realty & Development Co. In 1996, he and his wife created and developed The Inn at Robert's Grove, one of the leading resorts in Belize. Funeral services will be held on Thursday, October 8, at 1pm at Temple Beth- El, 350 Roxbury Rd., Stam- ford, CT.

docs.snippet: ROTHSTEIN--William A. The Board of Trustees of The Altschul Foundation regrets the passing of William A. Rothstein, a devoted and longtime trustee and officer of the Foundation, and offers its condolences to his family and friends. Billy brought c...
docs.lead_paragraph:
ROTHSTEIN--William A.

The Board of Trustees of The Altschul Foundation regrets the passing of William A. Rothstein, a devoted and longtime trustee and officer of the Foundation, and offers its condolences to his family and friends. Billy brought compassion, enthusiasm and dedication to his work on behalf of the Foundation and the various charitable causes he supported. His commitment to the Foundation will be greatly missed. The Trustees of The Altschul Foundation

headline.main: Merkel, Hollande to Present Common Front for EU in Crisis
headline.print_headline: Merkel, Hollande to Present Common Front for EU in Crisis

docs.snippet: Angela Merkel and Francois Hollande address the European Parliament on Wednesday, hoping to bolster EU cohesion to face interlocking crises in an echo of Franco-German unity in the days after the fall of the Berlin Wall....
docs.lead_paragraph: Angela Merkel and Francois Hollande address the European Parliament on Wednesday, hoping to bolster EU cohesion to face interlocking crises in an echo of Franco-German unity in the days after the fall of the Berlin Wall.
